newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps touch easier, bar heavy fuel up $1.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps touch easier, bar heavy fuel up $1.

text.p: European oil swaps were steady to a touch weaker by the end of Tuesday despite showing some resilience and strength earlier in the day. Tight prompt wet supplies of heavy fuel helped boost swap numbers by $1.

Brent CFDs were marginally easier with the balance of this week about one cent lower at -92/93 cents under August Brent. Further out there was evidence of more weakness with June 16-20 at -77 cents against August from -66 cents under August on Monday. June 23-27 was put at -67/68 (-64) while June 30-July 4 was assessed at -59 cents under August (-54).
The month of July traded at August -36 cents, June 16-20 went at July -50 cents and June 23-27 was concluded at July -38.

Heavy fuel swaps gained support from tight physical supplies and levels were about $1 a tonne stronger. June and July slipped in and out of contango and backwardation during the course of the day to end about 50 cents backwardated. June traded at $85.50 and 4Q went at $92.50.
Low sulphur swaps slipped about $1 since the physical market is not tight. June traded at $91.50 and $91.75, but there was little interest on July.

Attention on gasoline markets was directed towards wet deals where barges were done in a range of $188-193 with an early deal at $185. Dealers said barges had been hovering at $186-187 around lunchtime before jumping up on the back of a scramble to cover nominations.
June swaps were plugged around $189 with July at about $184. An August swap was concluded at $183.50.
Naphtha faced a slow market with swaps losing ground with June pegged at $179 and July about 25 to 50 cents backwardated.
